intro: Hieracium tumescens subsp. molybdochroum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats such as meadows and roadsides. It has a rosette of basal leaves and produces numerous flowering stems that bear small, clustered yellow flowers. The species is notable for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
